newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's BM&F sees higher agri-contracts turnover.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's BM&F sees higher agri-contracts turnover.

text.p: Turnover of agricultural contracts at Brazil's Futures and Commodities Exchange known as the BM&F should reach $2.48 billion in 1996, up from $1.62 billion in 1995, said a spokeswoman for the exchange.
The BM&F agricultural contracts include coffee and live cattle, sugar which started up in September of 1995 and soybeans which began trading in October 1995.
On a percentage basis, the agricultural contracts have seen more than a 100 percent rise in their contribution to total business on the exchange.
However that share still remains only 0.18 percent of total turnover, up from 0.08 percent in 1995.
The BM&F ended 1995 with a market turnover of $3 trillion, 100 percent higher than in 1994.
-- Caroline Bulloch, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 5074151
